poem:
Title: "The Boisterous Call of Peace"

In Normandy's shadows, they convene,
Leaders bonded by history's ruthless scene.
Biden, Macron; strong voices rise,
In unity, towards the Eastern skies.
"No bowing down," the cry reverberates,
"Ukraine, your struggle reverberates -
In freedom's heart, we fix our gaze,
Determined echoes of D-Day's haze.
Yet in surrender, lies strength unseen,
The quiet courage of peace, serene.
